name: smartseq2-full-length
title: Smart-seq2 Full-Length Transcript Analysis
description: Process Smart-seq2 full-length scRNA-seq data. Captures complete transcripts from individual cells with high sensitivity for isoform analysis and low-input samples.
content:
Smart-seq2 Full-Length Transcriptomics

Smart-seq2 is a plate-based scRNA-seq protocol that captures full-length transcripts from individual cells with high sensitivity. Unlike droplet-based methods (10X), it sequences the entire transcript for isoform resolution.

Why Smart-seq2?

  • Full-Length Coverage: 5' to 3' transcript coverage
  • High Sensitivity: Detects 5000-10000 genes per cell
  • Isoform Detection: Splice variant resolution
  • SNP Calling: Allelic expression from sequencing depth
  • Low Cell Numbers: Works with <100 cells
  • Individual Cells: Pick specific cells (FACS sorted)

Smart-seq2 vs 10X Chromium

FeatureSmart-seq210X
Throughput96-384 cells1000-10000 cells
CoverageFull-length3' or 5' end
Genes/Cell5000-100001000-4000
Isoforms✅ Yes❌ Limited
SNPs✅ Yes❌ No
Cost/Cell$10-20$1-2
InputSingle cellsCell suspension

Scientific Applications

  • Rare Cell Types: Analyze specific cells (FACS sorted)
  • Developmental Biology: Trace lineages with full transcripts
  • Isoform Analysis: Splice variants per cell
  • Allelic Expression: Parental allele usage
  • Low Cell Number Studies: <100 cells available
  • High Sensitivity Required: Need maximum gene detection
  • Benchmarking: Gold standard for scRNA-seq validation

Use Cases

When to Use Smart-seq2:

  • Small cell populations (<500 cells)
  • Need full-length transcripts
  • Isoform analysis required
  • SNP/allelic expression important
  • High gene sensitivity needed

When to Use 10X Instead:

  • Large cell numbers (>1000)
  • Gene-level counts sufficient
  • Cost is limiting factor
  • Population discovery (not specific cells)

Pipeline Features

  • Alignment: STAR aligner for splice-aware mapping
  • Quantification: RSEM or featureCounts
  • Quality Control: Per-cell metrics (genes, UMIs, %mito)
  • Normalization: SCTransform or log-normalization
  • Batch Correction: Remove plate effects

Input Requirements

Paired-end FASTQ files with wildcard pattern:

  • Pattern: *_{1,2}.fastq.gz
  • Example: cell01_R1.fastq.gz, cell01_R2.fastq.gz
  • Genome: Reference genome (GRCh38, GRCm39, etc.)

Key Outputs

  • Gene Counts: Expression matrix (genes × cells)
  • Isoform Counts: Transcript-level quantification
  • QC Report: Per-cell quality metrics
  • BAM Files: Aligned reads for IGV visualization
  • Allelic Counts: SNP-level expression (if variants provided)

Perfect for: Rare cells • Full-length transcripts • Isoform analysis • SNP detection • Low cell numbers • High sensitivity
